fields.description: When one creates/edits a User Macro, have three additional fields on the screen. The first one specifies which section of the notation guide to list that macro. The second field allows one to write the text that goes in the "Notation" column. The 3rd field allows one to write the text that goes in the "Comment" column.
fields.summary: Allow custom help to be specified for User Macros

fields.description: We are using JIRA groups for external user management in Confluence.  We have too many groups to show up on one page in Confluence when granting group permissions.    When I click to the second page in the list, I get an error.  (see attachment)   I get $groupnameTerm in a Search window, and the message that no groups met my criteria.

fields.description: Currenly we can localize the text inside the properties file to Japanese, but cannot edit all the URLs and email addresses which are being inserted dynamically. As a distributor, we'd appreciate the ability to localize these links and email addresses as well, just the same way it has been done for JIRA. You can create a separate properties file for that or change this one, whichever is more suitable.
fields.summary: Please allow editing of links and email addresses included in the ConfluenceActionSupport.properties file

fields.description:
Confluence stacktrace occurs when attempting to edit the groups of an LDAP user while running on atlassian user ldap. When using atlassian user, ldap should handle both authentication and group management, so the ability to edit groups from within Confluence when using atlassian user should be disabled. Note that group management for users should still be enabled when using os-user ldap (and non ldap of course).

To duplicate, edit user groups for any LDAP user.

fields.description:
This bug crept into an early downloadable version of the 2.2.1 release. People downloading 2.2.1a after the official announcement of the release (May 18th) will not encounter this problem.

If you encounter this error, install the attached PageChildrenMacro.class file into confluence/WEB-INF/classes/com/atlassian/confluence/renderer/v2/macros/
fields.summary: {children} macro fails with IndexOutOfBoundsException when viewing children of another page in the same space.

fields.description: When you try to save a page displaying an attached image, you get the error "The collection was unreferenced; nested exception is net.sf.hibernate.QueryException: The collection was unreferenced" in the edit window.
fields.summary: Copying a page with an image on it causes an error

fields.description:
How are we planning to support CamelCase linking for foreign languages which do no have a concept of Capital letters, like Japanese?

There is a related request here --  to allow automatic page linking in case the word matches the title of an existing page: 
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-1246
fields.summary: How will CamelCase be supported for Japanese language?

fields.description: When you edit a space layout you are actually editing the main layout
fields.summary: Editing space layouts edits the main layout instead
add View, Edit, Attachments, and Info tab at the bottom of the Confluence window.

fields.description:
I moved a set of pages from my private space to a space I share with the rest of my company and its customers. The pages had links to each other.

When I moved the set, the link texts were changed to show the space label of the space from where the pages were moved. See the attached PDF, pages 15-16, for an example. The PDF was generated by exporting these pages.
fields.summary: when I move a set of pages from one space to another, cross links between the pages are prefixed with the space label from the original space

fields.description:
The order of sub-pages under a page appears arbitrary. 

This not only effects the view in the hierarchy but how the pages are exported. In an export PDF, the corresponding sections are out of sequence.

I request being able to edit the order.

In the attached PDF, page 3 shows how I want the sections sequenced. This is very different from the order in the PDF book.
fields.summary: The order of sub-pages under a page is arbitrary. I would like to change the order of pages that appear in a child pages hierarchy

fields.description: Pages that I have modified recently are not appearing on the Dashboard.  Please see the attached screen shots.
fields.summary: Modified pages do not appear on the Dashboard

fields.description:
When adding groups to space permissions it allows you to add multiple versions of the same group with different capitalisations. The permissions only work for the group with the right capitalisation.

I've attached a screen shot.

Minor bug, but one that has confused the hell out of us, and I was lucky to spot what was going on.
fields.summary: Space permissions capitalisation problems - only with groups
When using default themes, all confluence pages should fit within 1024 x 768 design spec

Useful exception description are not shown not shown when database configuration is incorrect, for example, logs show that

When SID is incorrect, log reports TNS:listener does not currently know of SID given in connect descriptor

It might be useful for troubleshooting purposes to print out exceptions (though probably not the full stack trace) when the database connection fails.

fields.description:
We've just upgraded to version 2.2.  Prior to this users were able to edit their profile details and change their homepage.  Now the edit my profile tab does not allow any editing.  See the attached screen shot.
BTW, we are using JIRA's user DB for Confluence users.
fields.summary: Edit my profile does not allow user to edit

fields.description: It would be great if users could add content to  a Confluence page via email. Stephen Danelutti from netociety (one of our partners) has suggested this feature.
fields.summary: Email content to a page
Page level email integration.

fields.description:
The behaviour of the 'Edit' button currently seems to be 'Revert To Saved'. When editing a page, then making changes, if a user clicks edit again the page reverts to the original saved version and erases the current draft without a chance for recovery. This means that all updates are unexpectedly lost. I tend to click on edit when previewing my changes with the intention of correcting a minor error, then find that I must restart from scratch. 

When the user is currently editing and clicks on edit, it may be preferable to go to the exact same text being previewed (ie save a draft on edit click and display that in the default editor, rather than the original). I have confirmed this on CAC and that if a draft is offered, it does not appear to have any of the changes made since the page was loaded for editing. The date indicates that any drafts shown are either for a historically lost edit (eg yesterday) , or the very beginning of the edit, though I am not 100% thanks to the American timezone on the CAC.
fields.summary: Draft is unexpectedly lost by clicking edit

fields.description: After upgrading from version 2.1.5a to 2.2 via site backup and restore, each space is reset to the default color scheme, while the main administrative console retains the custom global color scheme.  Each page CAN be reset to use the global, but I don't think this should be necessary if each site used the global before the upgrade.
fields.summary: Spaces do not inherit global color scheme after upgrade from 2.1.5a to 2.2

fields.description: Several people in the office are reporting that they are not receiving the Daily Updates email even though they have checked the box.  They still continue to receive the individual emails whenever changes occur.
fields.summary: Subscription to Daily Updates not working

fields.description:
Essentially, the removeModule method of the ServletModuleManager class in atlassian-plugins is broken; it removes the paths (and that's debatable, as the removeMappingsForKey method in seraph's PathMapper class only removes from complexPaths (possibly incorrectly) and ignores mappings - leaving the mapping there) but *crutially* leaves the inittedServlets map alone.

I suspect that adding "inittedServlets.remove(descriptor.getCompleteKey());" to the removeModule method will sort the problems I am getting ... however that will certainly mask the path mapping issue which will need to be checked (just to be sure).

Steps to repo:

1. upload to confluence plugin 1
2. goto the URL (should read: Hello World!)
3. uninstall and upload plugin 2 (enable if needed)
4. goto the URL (should still read: Hello World!)
5. restart confluence
6. goto the URL (should read: Hello Mum!)

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6160].
  {panel}

It would be nice if confluence would allow to disable the user profile of someone who is (should) not using confluence anymore.

Use case: sombedoy leaves the company, we need to close/disable his user profile. 

Please note that existing content should not break. So refering to user xyz through [~xyz] should still work but clicking on the link should clearly state that the user is not "active" anymore.

Note that we should be able to undo this operation at all time.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Show on user profile that a user is inactive

fields.description:
We have a problem handling our attachments with special characters in their names, Like "ä.txt" or "ê.txt". While we can upload and download them there is no way to remove or edit/rename them. If trying to do so Confluence reports:

------------
The following error(s) occurred:

    * The attachment specified does not exist.

There are currently no attachments on this page. 
------------

Hitting the refresh button the attachments are there again, unchanged.
fields.summary: Unable to edit/remove attachments with special characters like umlauts

fields.description:
Create a user A, create their personal space, choose 'me' for view permissions.

Log on as user B, you see a link to User A's personal space on recently updated, but following it gives a not permitted page.
fields.summary: Personal spaces appear on recently updated, even when the personal space is not accessible

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6157].
  {panel}

https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-3889

The SOAP API is not really consistent. I guess that confluence still keeps the "basic" user profile even if a personal space is created. This has a nasty side effect. Here's the scenario:

# Set the description of a basic profile using the soap API (RemoteUserInformation) -> works OK and update the profile
# Create a personal space forr this user
# Run the same command again -> confluence does not complain but nothing is updated either ...
fields.summary: Updating user profile via remote API does nothing when user has a personal space

fields.description:
When using Safari, exporting a page as a Word document on a 2.2 (or 2.1.5) instance results in a file called "exportword.action", rather than "PAGENAME.doc". Using Firefox 1.5.0.1 on the same machine works, however.

It seems like CONF-5163 fixed it for IE, but not for Safari.
fields.summary: Exporting a page as a Word document in Safari saves as "exportword.action", instead of the page name

fields.description:
I was creating/editing a page in Rich Text mode on the wiki and I wanted to insert a link.  I clicked on the "Insert/Edit Link" icon and the Link Properties window opened.  However, no matter what I typed in the "Link" and "Alias" fields, when I clicked on either the OK or Cancel buttons, nothing happened.  The Link Properties window remained open and nothing changed on the page that I was editing.

I asked a couple of other users to try it on their computers and they had the same experience.
fields.summary: Link Properties in Rich Text Mode Not Working
export/import of wiki files for doing global search & replaces or for doing offline editing

fields.description:
When the page contains script tags, the PDF generation fails to correctly handle the script code source if it contains < and > characters.

Ex : create a page with the following code : {html}<script><!-- < > Hello World --></script>{html} (HTML macro needed) and export it to PDF.

"Hello World" appears in the PDF while it does not on the page.

The problem is rather problematic with the SQL macro : it generates a javascript code to allow dynamic column ordering for generated tables and this script can not be disabled.
fields.summary: PDF and HTML script tag

fields.description:
I sometimes rename pages (kinda like refactoring the site when you think of nicer ways to lay stuff out).

However I don't like breaking URLs - I could have sent a page's URL to someone on an email or whatever - then the URL is now broken. It'd be nice if Confluence remembered the old page names - then if you try go to a page it can't find, it looks in a table of redirects so that URLs still work..

I manually try to fix this myself by adding a new page, then editing the old page to include the new page. So maybe we need an option when renaming a page to 'keep old link' - which basically creates a new page with the new name/URL - and then auto-creates a page with the old name which includes the new page.

e.g. if I have a page Foo and I rename it to Bar, it creates a new Bar page with the content from Foo in it; then it creates a Foo page like

{include:Bar}
fields.summary: add a way to support 'redirects' if you rename a page
add an easy way to edit included pages

fields.description:
https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-3869

This is best explained by following these instructions.
Go to the Demonstration Space. Then goto the "Export Space" page (via Browse Space -> Advanced). Chose PDF output. In the pages to export, uncheck "Confluence Overview" and "Index". Now observe the list of those pages that remain checked, in particular their order. Now perform the export and examine the resulting PDF. Observe that the pages exported are in a different order than that presented in the web view.

The only workaround for this is to ensure that the parent page of a bunch of pages is also exported. But then that causes a page to be exported that I don't want.
fields.summary: Order of pages in export is not consistent with web view

fields.description:
Got this problem from a customer in email. I've sent him the ticket so he can track the status:

Hi Ernest (and Jon),

No problem on any delay: Jon Silvers (in San Francisco) was very  helpful in arranging XML backups of the two spaces as well (thank you  again, Jon!).  It is good news that JIRA supports local online docs,  thanks for checking on that for me.

Unfortunately, I have a problem to report.  It would appear the space  restore from XML backup is broken in some way, with respect to  attachments.  Comments appear intact, but all attachments are  inaccessible.

We are using the standalone build#512 (v2.2), on an Apple XServ  running Mac OS X Server 10.4.6 (Tiger), communicating to a remote  PostgreSQL 7.4.7 (debian "sarge") using the latest JDBC driver (501)  from jdbc.postgresql.org.  We are using the default configuration for  attachments, storing them on the fs.

I can fetch the "system information" page for our configuration if  needed.  By the way, our next eval phase is planned to deploy the WAR/ EAR lash-up alongside a JIRA eval, using the Mac OS X Server LDAP for  authentication.

**After restoring either the CONF20 or DOC spaces, and indexing:
- (OK) all pages/hierarchies appear intact -- even the confluence  "Team" name showed up;
- (OK) all attachments LIST under the spaces' attachment tabs
- (FAIL) ALL inline images display as broken icons within any page  that contains them;
- (FAIL) ALL attachments cannot be found;
- (FAIL) accessing any attachment produces server ERROR page (~  "attachment not found where expected")
- (FAIL) /var/confluence/attachments/ contains no new items/directories

I have tried to import the CONF20 and DOC spaces numerous times now  with XML exports obtained by directly accessing the  confluence.atlassian.com website as well as those exports provided by  you and Jon.  I've utilized both restore space methods of uploading  backup via browser as well as a "local restore" after transferring  the backups to the configured confluence "restore" directory (under / var/confluence/ in my case).

During the various restore attempts I could see the backups were  unzipped into "/var/confluence/temp/import{name_varies}/" where I can  find the "attachments" subdir, containing the usual hash dirs.

At the end of the restore process I briefly saw that a new directory,  "/var/confluence/temp/import{name_varies}/new.attachments" (or  similar) was created, containing the same hash dirs as the apparently- to-be-restored attachments dir.  Once the restore completed the the  entire "/var/confluence/temp/import{name_varies}/" was removed, as I  would expect.

No changes are ever made to /var/confluence/attachments/.  However,  during normal use of confluence, making NEW attachments in other  spaces does work and does change the contents of /var/confluence/ attachments, both before and after the restore process.

Any suggestions you have would be greatly appreciated.


John L.
fields.summary: space  restore from XML backup

fields.description:
You have two spaces test and test2.

You add pages to space test2 with umlauts in title like "Döner" or "Pöbel".

You go to the test space's  page "Home" and EDIT.

You add a link to the page with target space '"test2" and the page "Döner".

While you are still in the EDIT mode and WYSIWYG view the link is shown with an emoticon in the middle of the text.

When you save this you have corrupted links to nowhere.
fields.summary: WYSIWYG mode is turnig space:page link like test:Döner to emoticon and a corrupted link

fields.description:
After performing an update from Confluence 2.0.1 and Jira 3.4.3 to the new versions:

Opening a page for edition using the Rich Text Editor (or roundtripping if Wiki Editor is the default one) adds double width and heigth properties to the picture links. Example:

[!annuaire.gif|width=50, height=50!|http://annuaire-cv.corp.thales/httpldap/]
becomes 
[!annuaire.gif|width=50, height=50!|width=50, height=50!|http://annuaire-cv.corp.thales/httpldap/]
after the round trip (or even if you open it in Rich Text Editor as a default)

As a consequence, I had to disable the Rich Text Editor in the newly installed versions.
fields.summary: Editing a page with the Rich Text Editor breaks picturized links.

fields.description: View groups for an LDAP user.  Both LDAP and non-LDAP groups are listed (nice!).  Only the non-LDAP groups can be added/removed (good).  Remove any or all of the non-LDAP groups.  UI shows the groups removed.  Go back to viewing the user.  Removed groups are back!!!  Repeat process, same result.  Same if I use remote API to remove the group.  I would appreciate a work around at least.  Thanks.
fields.summary: Cannot remove LDAP user from local confluence group

fields.description:
For usernames with spaces the Preferences link is rendered as .../users/viewuserprofile.action?username=Wolfram%2BRichter which leads to page cannot be displayed.
Manually entering .../users/viewuserprofile.action?username=Wolfram+Richter works though.

The reason we are forced to use the fullname is that the loginname is coupled to the userName Attribute for LDAP authentication.

When I turn on the logging of the atlassian user management in <confluence_home>/WEB-INF/classes/log4j.properties the entered passwords get logged in plaintext. Is this necessary?


Thanks Ludwig

fields.description:
The Google Firefox toolbar prefetches the RSS autodiscovery feeds in Confluence which are secured by Basic Auth. This prompts the user for a login and password where in fact they're already logged in to Confluence with a cookie.

This issue has been filed with Google.
fields.summary: Google toolbar prefetches stuff without the 'X-Moz' prefetch header

fields.description:
By default, Hibernate uses a BLOB type (limited to 64 KB) instead of the LONGBLOB type (limited to 2 GB). When migrating attachments to the database in Confluence 2.2, they get truncated to 64 KB without an error.

Two things we should do:
- use the LONGBLOB type in MySQL for attachment storage
- use the 'Traditional' SQL mode in MySQL so errors when writing data are raised as errors rather than silently dropped.

http://dev.mysql.com/doc/refman/5.0/en/server-sql-mode.html
fields.summary: Attachments truncated to 64k in MySQL database storage

fields.description:
Currently if you !embed! something and we can't determine the MIME type from the attachment type or extension, you get an annoying red error message.

This causes a problem for things like external images that don't have file extensions (i.e. graphs we're pulling from dynamic apps on other sites). If we defaulted to rendering these things as images, we'd be right 95% of the time.
fields.summary: Default !embed! rendering to if we can't determine the mime type

fields.summary: Single page PDF export fails

fields.description: In particular, there are *many* support calls from people who have not installed the adaptivist Utilities plugin -- if they could be told what to do it would save a lot of work.
fields.summary: Better reporting of unsatisfied plugin dependencies

fields.description:
When I export a set of related pages, I deselect all and then select a range of pages. If I select a page in the middle of a hierarchy, I expect all pages beneath that page to be automatically selected. Instead, I have to laboriously check every page under the higher level.

I request automatic selection of all pages under a higher level.
fields.summary: When exporting subset of pages to PDF, etc., select a page. This automatically should selct all pages under it in its hierarchy.

fields.description:
I type the name of an attached image file as "!filename.ext!" in the wiki editor and when I perform Preview or Save, the text is automatically converted to "\!filename.ext\!" and I see the filename string, etc. instead of the image.

This is extremely irrititating and time wasting! 

Please fix this immediately!
fields.summary: !filename.ext! is converted to \filename.ext\!

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6112].
  {panel}

I've been busy lately writing a simple soap client application that updates each user profiles with data contained in an administrative database. This is running fine so far but we'll have troubles with update.

Each profile contains the contact information of the user, the phone number, etc. If this information changes (it happens quite often), we need to update the user profile ourselves sometimes.

I think there is an inconsistency in confluence on this point. As an administrator I can edit the user details of any user using the SOAP API but I can't using the web interface !!

Would it be possible to add the Edit Profile tab on each user, provided that the current user is loggued as a confluence-administrator?
fields.summary: Administrator should be able to edit user's profile

fields.description:
Cannot search for strings containing a colon. 

Steps to recreate:
* enter the following on a page:           pt:userInfo
* wait for index to be updated (usually 1 minute)
* search for the following:     pt:userInfo
* no results are found
fields.summary: Indexing & Searching problems with colon character

fields.description:
Even if you correctly configure an LDAP provider in your osuser.xml file, it will be ignored. 

When a user tries to login, Confluence will authenticate against the password of the local account only.
fields.summary: CLONE -LDAP Authentication via OSUser is broken
Extend {include:page} to be able to include only parts of a page

fields.description:
Referring to https://support.atlassian.com/browse/CSP-3887

The following doc needs to be updated accordingly:
http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+a+MySQL+Datasource+in+Tomcat

The syntax as of Tomcat 5.5 is (quoting the above mentioned support request):

<Resource name="jdbc/intradb" auth="Container" type="javax.sql.DataSource"
        username="confluence_int_u"
        password="******"
        driverClassName="com.mysql.jdbc.Driver"
        url="jdbc:mysql://localhost/confluence_intra_utf8?autoReconnect=true&amp
;useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF8"
        validationQuery="Select 1" />

Thanks to Kalle Hallivuori for pointing that out.
fields.summary: Documentation needs updating - setting up a MySQL Datasource is different in the Tomcat 5.5 (shipped with Confluence 2.2)

fields.description: When attachment storage is set to database, attachments are not backed up
fields.summary: Attachments are not included in backup when stored in database

fields.description: Needs to include setup, optimisation and any 'gotchas' we've discovered along the way.
fields.summary: Document cluster configuration

fields.description:
Site export should exclude Bandana settings from entities.xml, and export same as old Bandana.

Space export needs to include space-specific Bandana settings which are currently excluded.
fields.summary: Fix import/export of database-backed Bandana settings

fields.description:
Should show details about the nodes in the cluster:

- description, ip & port
- app server, JVM
- performance: heap usage, CPU?
- any node-specific settings (database connections?)
fields.summary: Cluster admin screen

fields.description:
At the moment configuration changes to these settings aren't replicated across the cluster because they're stored as XML in confluence-home.

We need to store all configuration settings in Bandana, except those that relate to creation of the database connection.
fields.summary: Move all non-bootstrap configuration out of confluence.cfg.xml

fields.description: We need to distinguish between those upgrade tasks for each node (typically confluence-home changes) and those for the entire cluster (typically database changes).
fields.summary: Make upgrade system work properly in a cluster

fields.description:
Occurs in all Confluence instances, not just the cluster configuration.

Editing General Config takes a long time to open, especially when the server is under heavy load.
fields.summary: Editing General Configuration takes a long time to load

fields.description:
Database calls to retrieve Bandana information (especially character encoding) seems to have a big performance impact on Confluence. Caching database results should improve this.

We can either enable Hibernate's caching for the Bandana tables, or wrap the CachingBandanaProvider around the database-backed BandanaPersister.
fields.summary: Add caching to database-backed Bandana

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6099].
  {panel}

we have a webdav fileshare to which people occasionally create links in confluence.  the names of the files and folders on the share sometimes contain space characters, and people creating links to those files generally type a space when entering the link target.  Confluence sees the space and indicates an error on the page.

the space character is one of those "unsafe" characters which are not supposed to appear directly in URLs.  so confluence is probably correct in its behavior.  still, I think it might be useful to auto-encode user entered URLs, so people aren't required to manually encode them.

as an example, say I want to link to 

 http://www.example.com/My Files/file.txt

I would like to type the above, just as I typed it here, w/o replacing the space with %20, which might be OK for me but is difficult at best for people who haven't memorized the ASCII table.
fields.summary: external links should escape/encode space (etc.) characters

fields.description: When setting a line to heading 2 the actual formatting is applied on the line below the cursor. So after selecting the heading, and immediately start to type, your text is rendered normally as the line below contains the heading formating and appears as a blank line in the heading format (heading 2 style: background colour and underline).
fields.summary: When setting a line to heading 2 the actual formatting is applied on the line below the cursor

fields.description: Whilst editing a page in Confluence (after flipping between Rich text and Wiki Markup modes) whilst in Rich text mode I tried to cut some text from the Confluence page that I was editing. The cut was successful however the paste didn't operate.
fields.summary: During rich text editing paste function sporadically ceases to function

fields.description: Because of the delay in loading all the javascript, people have almost always moved the cursor before the page finishes loading, then the cursor jumps elsewhere. Annoying. Remove.
fields.summary: Don't placeFocus() on edit pages

fields.description:
The code macro unexpectedly drops some newlines between rich text and preview when the line contains a certain combination of <,> and / characters. To duplicate, go to wiki markup mode on a new page and enter 

{code:xml|title=With LDAP authentication added}
<provider class="com.atlassian.confluence.user.ConfluenceLDAPCredentialsProvider">
	<property name="java.naming.factory.initial">com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory</property>
	<property name="java.naming.provider.url">ldap://localhost:389</property>
	<property name="searchBase">dc=atlassian,dc=com</property>
	<property name="uidSearchName">cn</property>
	<!--

	<property name="java.naming.security.credentials">secret</property>

</provider>

</provider>

Note that 2 newlines were added by the rich text editor, when enter was only pressed once. Only one newline was expected. Now go to the preview pane and see that the both newlines are unexpectedly removed as below

fields.description:
A page was created by a user named 'admin'. The user 'admin' was removed, when I switched to LDAP authentication. When the page is hit, the following error is produced. Seems like this should not be an error, perhaps a warning at best.

{code}

fields.summary: Error thrown when user is deleted

fields.description:
We had confluence 2.1.1 before on port 80. During upgrade to 2.1.5a, what I did was that I shut down 2.1.1, then started it to a different port (8080) so that no one would be adding content while I was backing up.  After backing it up, I shut it down and did the upgrade to 2.1.5a.  Then I started the 2.1.5a on port 8080, made sure everything looked fine, then I shut it down and started 2.1.5a on port 80.

Everything seemed fine initially, but a few days later I noticed that all the tiny urls changed to port 8080 which was used only temporarily, therefore none of the tiny urls work any more.  This has become an issue since we've been telling people to use tiny urls and they email around with the tiny urls.  Simply getting rid of the port 8080 does not fix this at all.

Please advise.
fields.summary: TinyURLs messed up after starting confluence on a separate port temporarily, backup and upgrade

fields.description: Add more of the report columns from jira to the jiraissues macro. In particular we are after the description column. We use wiki markup in the description field in Jira to describe the issue in detail. Displaying this column in the Confluence report would also act as an a documentation mechanism as well. At this stage we are unable to render this field in the confluence report.
fields.summary: Extend the jiraissues macro to include more of the fields -Description

fields.description:
Attempt to upload different files with same name overwrites each other.
e.g. 

   /example1/log4j.properties    (comment "example1")
vs. 
   /example2/log4j.properties    (comment "example2")

Single file upload function creates a second version (replacement).
Multiple file upload function silently creates only a single reference.

Is it possible to support a path name or some other distinuisher?
fields.summary: Uploading multiple files with same name overwrite each other

fields.description:
As an administrator, when I restricting a page to a group, it only shows groups that I am a member of.  As an adminstrator, I should be able to see them all.

This is especially important when helping people set up the basic skeleton of their pages.
fields.summary: Restricting Pages - Administrator can only see groups they are part of
